sub_title: Msc Philosophy, Politics and Economics at University of Groningen
summary:
I am a recent honours graduate of Msc Philosophy, Politics and Economics at University of Groningen. I previously completed MA Philosophy and Economics at University of Glasgow, with first-class distinction. My key differentiation is a wide variety of extra-curricular involvement, ranging from co-representing 6000 students at the Glasgow Student Representative Council (SRC) in 2017, leading a sports club to a European Cup in 2018, to ranking fourth at the European Debate Championship in 2021. I have developed both leadership and collaboration skills, and have excelled in presentation and in-role learning.

I am currently seeking opportunities for shadowing and internships, with a primary focus on Project Management, Business Analysis, and Management Consulting.

awards.title: 5th place in the National piano competition for Music Schools
awards.description:
I took part in the competition for pianists at Music Schools, run by the Ministry of Education, which consisted of multiple rounds, with only a limited number of pianists passing through each to the next.

I passed through the schools' qualification round, finished first in the sub-regional and regional levels of the competition, and went to compete in the National round, held in Prague from the 20th to the 23rd of April 2017.

As one of the 7 pianists selected nationally to perform in my category (18-20 years old), I finished fifth with an Honourable mention.

awards.title: First place at Stock Pitch event
awards.description:
As a team of three with Marek Bojko and Marek Feder, we prepared a stock pitch fr Unilever PLC (LSE: ULVR).
I was in charge of the overall stock-pitch structure and financials.
Even though I had no previous experience with finance, in two weeks I managed to create a DCF analysis model (using perpetual growth method) to support our recommendation. While I was aware of my limited background in the area, I concentrated on delivering our findings clearly and convincingly, which gained us first place and overwhelmingly positive feedback on our presentation skills.

At the event, we delivered a 15 min presentation at Hilton Grosvenor to a panel of judges in senior management positions at Rathbones, KPMG, Scottish Equity Partners. We were announced in first place, because we justified our assumptions best and therefore our case stood the strongest.

This opportunity taught me how to work with a completely unknown subject under significant pressure, and gave me an experience of what Investment banking or other related careers can include.

projects.title: Professional Skills Programme
projects.description:
Took part in an ILM certified, three day long intensive program aimed at developing my workplace skills.
The modules attended were: Understanding and Articulating Your Strengths, Working With and Leading Teams, Managing Your Time, and Assertiveness.

Part of the programme were multiple high intensity team challenges, including a team presentation. Receiving very positive feedback, I was a member of the team which was voted Best presentation, and also was voted Best presenter/contributor.

projects.title: YODA mentorship programme
projects.description:
Project and personal-development centred programme.

Roughly bi-weekly meeting with my mentor, Eliska Remesova, helped me manage my time better (setting up a work/life balance) and develop the projects I was focusing on most (improving the Debate club meeting structure and finishing my school-leaving thesis).

As a result, I scheduled my time better and could present the improvements I made in our Debate club at a June Yoda mentees meeting, getting positive feedback on my work.

profile_positions.description:
After being at the university for a month. I decided to campaign for the position of First year representative at the University of Glasgow Student Representative Council (SRC). I composed a manifesto, attended a Heckling meeting and raised awareness about the election in my classes.

In October, I was elected to represent 6970 first year students as the First-year representative of the SRC. Further, I was elected to be member of two committees and am proactively forming two main projects that I want to pursuit during the year. In an environment of more experienced Council members, I am gathering information on how class representatives are selected and finding a way to improve this in the following semesters. Second, I am trying to create a platform for developing societies by propagating an unused stall in the Library.

profile_positions.title: Social Media Intern

volunteer_experiences.description:
After joining the team in October 2017, I attended the Annual General Meeting and put myself forward as a Social Media Manager. After being entrusted with this role, I took on the responsibility of regularly updating the team Facebook page to inform new potential members of our activity.

I unified the post colour scheme and design, and started regularly posting events about periodic training. During my two and a half months of participation, the number of Facebook page followers has risen from 510 to 565.

company.name: Debating club of Gymnázium BH v Nymburce

volunteer_experiences.description:
Motivated members and organised activities to help them develop as debaters and critical thinkers. I understood a lack of PR was threatening the club's continuity, and so I initiated and maintained a Facebook page, to get a platform on social media.
Improved the club's functioning by establishing a constitution, and developed exhibition debates (negotiated with senior members of staff at my school that they would be put directly into students' schedule, introduced feedback forms, and managed commentary of the debate). 
As part of the role, I led a workshop at the elementary school Jedna Radost Poděbrady on presentation skills and rhetorics.

I took up the role as choirmaster after the previous person in this role decided to step down, risking the continuity of the choir. Without any conducting education or experience, leading a group comprised mostly of elderly locals presented me with a serious challenge.
I led and organized weekly meetings of a small village choir, culminating in our performance at multiple charitable concerts during the Christmas season. We helped to raise money for church renovation, but also spread art in a rural area that typically lacks similar initiatives. 

I received positive feedback from the choir members, the previous choirmaster and also from the various concert organisers. Even though I haven't led the choir since, I still occasionally am contacted with offers of performance in the region.
